summary:
Stuart Schechter makes some good points on the history of bad password policies:
Morris and Thompson‚Äôs work brought much-needed data to highlight a problem that lots of people suspected was bad, but that had not been studied scientifically.  Their work was a big step forward, if not for two mistakes that would impede future progress in improving passwords for decades. 
First, was Morris and Thompson‚Äôs confidence that their solution, a password policy, would fix the underlying problem of weak passwords...
title: Good Essay on the History of Bad Password Policies
